title: Get Dragon Ball Sparking Zero And Kakarot Daima Edition For Just $30 Each In This Black Friday Deal
description: Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero $30 (was $60) See at Amazon See at Best Buy Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot - Daima Edition $30 (was $50) See at Amazon See at Best Buy Dragon Ball fans have eaten well lately with a feast of games based on the hit manga and anime series, and if you're looking to relive the adventures of Goku and his allies, you can get a great Black Friday deal on two excellent games in the franchise. Amazon has discounted Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot - Daima Edition to $30 (was $50) for the PS5 version, while the massive fighting game Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero has gotten a 50% discount and is available for $30 on both PS5 and Xbox Series X. Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero $30 (was $60) Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero is the most recent video game release in the franchise, and it's an anime-inspired slugfest with a massive roster of characters pulled from every era of Dragon Ball. Everyone from Goku to Vegeta is included in the game's lineup, and while the combat does have a steep learning curve, once you nail it you'll be throwing out Final Flash and Kamehameha attacks like a pro. The game also looks stunning in action, and if you grew up playing the Dragon Ball Budokai Tenkaichi games, then this will appeal to you as it's a continuation of that series. PS5 -- $30 ($60) Xbox Series X -- $30 ($60) See at Amazon See at Best Buy Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot - Daima Edition $30 (was $50) In comparison, Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot is an action-RPG that blends fast-paced fisticuffs with level-grinding. The game also gives you a world to explore as you take part in Goku's greatest battles across the Dragon Ball storyline, and since launch, publisher Bandai Namco has expanded on the game with several story DLC drops inspired by classic OVA series and Dragon Ball Super. The Daima Edition does not include those expansions, but it does come bundled with the two-part Daima DLC, which is based on the Dragon Ball Daima anime series. One thing to note here is that only the first part has been released so far, and Part Two will arrive in early 2026. See at Amazon See at Best Buy More Early Black Friday Deals at Amazon Video Game Deals PS5 Game Deals Nintendo Switch Game Deals Xbox Series X Game Deals Video Game Accessory Deals Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: We've Never Seen Anything Like Switch 2's Sales Before
description: Circana has released its latest monthly sales report, revealing which games and hardware sold the best during October 2025. Battlefield 6 topped the software charts and Nintendo's Switch 2 came out on top for hardware. According to Circana, the Switch 2 sold 328,000 units in the US in October. It's now pacing ahead of the original Switch by 68% and is also ahead 3% of the PlayStation 4's "previous record velocity" for sales. The Switch 2 helped lift US hardware sales in October to $351 million, which was up 36% year-over-year. The Switch 2 did so well it offset the year-over-year declines experienced by the original Switch (down 52%), Xbox Series X|S (down 37%), and PlayStation 5 (down 22%). Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Elden Ring Nightreign Drops To Just $25 For Black Friday
description: Elden Ring All Elden Ring games have gotten big Black Friday discounts All Elden Ring Black Friday deals at Amazon Out of all the souls-like games on the market, Elden Ring is considered to be the gold standard for the genre. From Software's masterpiece has sold tens of millions of copies since it was first released a few years ago, and if you've been looking to try it out, this Black Friday deal will get you the game for just $20 (was $40). Its award-winning expansion Shadow of the Erdtree and the spin-off game Elden Ring Nightreign have also received big discounts. Elden Ring $20 (was $50) This isn't the first time that Elden Ring has sold for $20, but the game is very rarely discounted to this low price. Similar to From Software's other souls-likes, Elden Ring is an elegantly grim game set in a land of fantasy, wonder, and danger. Game of Thrones author George RR Martin contributed to its lore and world, and everywhere you go, there's always something to discover in The Lands Between. It's only one of a select few games to earn a rare 10/10 score at GameSpot, as it's a game full of substance and style. If you decide to pick it up for PS5 but that version is sold out, the PS4 edition does offer a free PS5 upgrade. Elden Ring PS5 PS4 Xbox Series X See at Amazon See at Best Buy Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree Edition $40 - $50 (was $80) Shadow of the Erdtree isn't just a simple expansion for Elden Ring: It's an essential part of the experience and its grand sweeping narrative. While From Software could have done more of the same and simply called it a day, Shadow of the Erdtree adds an increased amount of new weapons, equipment, skills, and magic that are not found in the original game. Amazon is offering the Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree Edition for $50 on both PS5 and Xbox Series X, which gets you both Elden Ring and the expansion together in a single bundle. This normally costs $80 on its own and is rarely discounted this much, so this is quite the savings. Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree Edition PS5 -- $50 Xbox Series X -- $40 See at Amazon See at Best Buy Elden Ring Nightreign $25-$35 Released earlier this year, Elden Ring Nightreign retains the gameplay that made the original game and its expansion so popular, but it reimagines the experience as a co-op boss rush game set in the land of Limveld--an alternate version of Elden Ring's Limgrave. Gameplay revolves around players teaming up and choosing a boss to fight, leveling up during the day for a brutal showdown at night. Expeditions generally last around 35-45 minutes, making for breezy but enjoyable gameplay sessions. You can get either the standard edition or the Amazon-exclusive edition on sale, with Amazon's version offering additional playable characters and bosses, a digital artbook, mini soundtrack, and a poster of the game's key art, all for an extra $10. "Elden Ring's DNA is ever-present, but Nightreign is also a game of striking subversions: a From Software game that asks you to play it unconventionally, disregarding meticulous exploration, isolation, and measured combat for a cooperative multiplayer game built on speed and aggression. In many ways, it's the antithesis of what people typically come to From Software games for, and yet somehow, someway, this experimental non-sequel is an absolute triumph," Richard Wakeling wrote in GameSpot's Elden Ring: Nightreign review. Elden Ring Nightreign (Amazon-Exclusive Edition) -- $35 PS5 Xbox Series X Elden Ring Nightreign -- $25 PS5 Xbox Series X See at Amazon See at Best Buy More Early Black Friday Deals at Amazon Video Game Deals PS5 Game Deals Nintendo Switch Game Deals Xbox Series X Game Deals Video Game Accessory Deals Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: An Unexpected Developer Is Behind Some Big Free Switch 2 Updates
description: Four notable free Switch 2 updates for big-name Nintendo games--such as Super Mario Odyssey--surprisingly came from outside the company. Instead of an internal developer, Panic Button has confirmed working on the following titles for the new hybrid console: Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe, Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury, and Arms. On X, Panic Button revealed its involvement on the free Switch 2 updates. "Nintendo asked us to help demonstrate new capabilities of the Nintendo Switch 2 system, while remaining faithful to the original games," the Austin-based developer stated on social media. The improvements included HDR support for Arms, Super Mario Odyssey, and Bowser's Fury. In addition, GameShare support was added to Super Mario Odyssey and Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury. Panic Button was honored to be selected by Nintendo to help update marquee games from the Nintendo Switch™ library. Nintendo asked us to help demonstrate new capabilities of the Nintendo Switch 2 system, while remaining faithful to the original games. pic.twitter.com/5P96V9DFUq — Panic Button (Official) (@PanicButtonGame) November 19, 2025 For those unfamiliar, Panic Button has a well-regarded history of bringing games to Switch platforms. For instance, the team was behind Doom and Doom Eternal for the original Switch. Panic Button assisted on porting Warframe to Switch as well. Most recently, the developer worked on Forza Horizon 5 for PS5--marking the first time the racing franchise has appeared on a PlayStation platform. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Battlefield 6's First-Month Sales Were Higher Than Any Game Since 2022 In The US
description: Battlefield 6 launched on October 10 and didn't need much time to become 2025's best-selling game overall in the US based on dollar sales. Circana released its latest monthly report today, confirming that Battlefield 6 was October 2025's No. 1 best-selling game and, after just three weeks on sale, became the No. 1 best-selling game of 2025 for physical and digital sales. Battlefield 6 is also the No. 1 best-selling game on the Xbox and PC charts for 2025, while it ranks No. 2 for 2025 on PlayStation (second only to NBA 2K26). EA's new Battlefield game also became the best-selling game in Battlefield franchise history in the US for its first month. 2018's Battlefield 1 was the previous record-holder, and in fact, the first-month sales volume for Battlefield 6 has surpassed the lifetime sales of Battlefield 1. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Little Nightmares 3 Gets Its First Big Discount For Black Friday
description: Little Nightmares 3 $30 (was $40) See at Amazon See at Walmart See at Best Buy Little Nightmares 3 Deluxe Edition $45 (was $60) See at Amazon See at Target See at Best Buy Spooky season might be over, but you can keep the thrills going with this Black Friday deal on Little Nightmares 3. Bandai Namco's creepy adventure game launched in October, and you can pick it up for just $30 on PS5, Xbox Series X, and Switch 2. Or if you feel like treating yourself, the Little Nightmares 3 Deluxe Edition is also on sale right now for $45 (was $60). Little Nightmares 3 $30 (was $40) An atmospheric adventure game, Little Nightmares 3 follows best friends Low and Alone as they search for an escape from the dreadful land of Nowhere. While the game has plenty of danger to avoid and puzzles to solve, it does have a fun gameplay hook in that you can share the peril with a friend in co-op. Developed by the horror veterans at Supermassive Games, the end result is a cinematic horror-platformer built for two players. PS5 Xbox Series X Switch Switch 2 See at Amazon See at Walmart See at Best Buy Little Nightmares 3 Deluxe Edition $45 (was $60) The Little Nightmares 3 Deluxe Edition is essentially a collector's edition without physical extras. This version comes with post-launch story chapters and a hefty amount of costumes for the characters. In total, you're getting four characters and costumes in the Residents Costumes Pack and two more costumes in the Ferryman Costumes Set. PS5 Xbox Series X Switch Switch 2 See at Amazon See at Target See at Best Buy "This is a good sequel that I'm glad to have made the time for, but if there's to be another trip into this world of tiny terrors, it'll first need a refill of nightmare fuel," Mark Delaney wrote in GameSpot's Little Nightmares 3 review. More Early Black Friday Deals at Amazon Video Game Deals Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac Is Just $20 For Black Friday
description: Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac $20 (was $30) See at Amazon Pac-Man is an enduring icon of the 2D era of gaming, but over the decades, Bandai Namco's mascot has made a few forays into 3D. If you're curious to see just how well Pac-Man translates into the the third dimension, then you can score a discount on Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac as part of a Black Friday deal. A remake of the classic 3D platformer that first launched for PS2, GameCube, and Xbox in 2002, it's on sale for just $20 (was $30) on PS5, Xbox Series X, Switch 2, and Switch. Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac $20 (was $30) These physical copies of the game include reversible cover art sleeves, allowing you to choose between the new Re-Pac artwork and a recreation of the original 2002 cover art. As you'd expect for a game that hasn't been in the spotlight for more than two decades, there have been quite a few enhancements added to this version of Pac-Man World 2. Not only has the audio and graphical quality of the game been substantially updated, but quality-of-life changes have also smoothed many of the rough edges from the original game. Additionally, this version offers updated boss battles, a two-player mode for some co-op fun, voice acting, and several levels have been expanded. PS5 Xbox Series X Switch 2 Switch See at Amazon Taking place after the mischievous ghosts Blinky, Pinky, Inky, and Clyde steal the golden fruit from Pac-Village--and accidentally unleash the all-powerful ghost Spooky--Pac-Man World 2 sees the hero journey to stop the spooks from taking over the globe. Playing like a Saturday morning cartoon adventure, Pac-Man would explore a wide variety of stages full of enemies and hazards, using his skills to triumph. More Early Black Friday Deals at Amazon Video Game Deals Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Digimon Time Stranger Gets First Discount For Black Friday
description: Digimon Story: Time Stranger standard edition $50 (was $70) See at Amazon Digimon Story: Time Stranger Ultimate Edition $90 (was $120) See at Amazon Amazon's Black Friday deals continue to roll in, including great deals recently released video games like Digimon Story: Time Stranger. The new entry in the long-running Digimon Story RPG series has been well-received so far, and if you haven't checked it out yet, you can grab the standard edition for just $50 (was $70) on both PS5 and Xbox Series X, or if you feel like spoiling yourself, the Ultimate Edition has been discounted to $90 (was $120). These are limited-time deals, so grab them before the sale ends--or the game sells out. Digimon Story: Time Stranger standard edition $50 (was $70) The standard edition of Digimon Story: Time Stranger includes the base game on either PS5 or Xbox Series X. Amazon's deal only applies to the physical version of the game. See at Amazon Digimon Story: Time Stranger Ultimate Edition $90 (was $120) Digimon Story: Time Stranger Ultimate Edition lives up to its name. It includes the base game, a Digimon collectible trading card, and additional bonus DLC. Here's everything included in this version: Digimon Story: Time Stranger base game Exclusive Digimon TCG card Ultimate Edition game case with unique cover art Special Agumon and Gabumon early unlocks Deluxe Edition Costume Pack (12 Costumes - 3 per character + 3 Side Missions) Cyber Sleuth Costume Set Digimon Story: Time Stranger Season Pass with: 15 additional Digimon Three additional story episodes Golden Moai Bonus Farm Item Public Safety Suit Bonus Costume Special Supplies Set Cyber Sleuth BGM Pack Amazon's deal applies to both the physical PS5 and Xbox Series X versions of Digimon Story: Time Stranger Ultimate Edition. See at Amazon Like several other Digimon games, Digimon Story: Time Stranger sees players once again journey across the human world and Digital World to collect Digimon and fight in turn-based battles. The game also focuses on the bond between humans and their Digimon, and Time Stranger improved on the traditional turn-based combat systems for this new release. When you're not battling, you can also live your best digi-life by building a home and running a Digi-shop, which in turn opens the door to more questing opportunities. "Digimon Story: Time Stranger is a strong argument that it's high time to give the digital monsters their own space in the critter-catching genre. Strong voice acting and mature themes digivolve this time-traveling tale into an emotionally-rewarding journey of grief and self-acceptance, and a vast array of branching options keeps team-building and the turn-based combat exciting," Jordan Ramée wrote in GameSpot's Digimon Story: Time Stranger review. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Kill Bill's The Bride Rides Into Fortnite In Chapter 7 Teaser
description: While Fortnite is currently in the midst of a Springfieldian takeover by The Simpsons, the next chapter of the battle royale's overarching story will soon be upon us. Epic Games has ramped up the teases for what's to come, including a short trailer featuring a certain yellow-clad bride bent on revenge. The trailer shows many of the main collaborations from Chapter 6--Godzilla, Homer Simpson, and the Megazord among them--before The Bride from Kill Bill speeds into the scene to save Jonesy from danger. The teaser then confirms the end-of-Chapter-6 event will take place November 29 at 11 AM PT / 2 PM ET. Last night, Fortnite took over the Vista Theater in Hollywood, California for a massive Chapter 7 kickoff event for media and influencers that featured even more hints. Logos on decorations around the theater seem to confirm Chapter 7 Season 1's name as Pacific Break, while the DeLorean from Back to the Future also appeared in the theater itself. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Steam Machine Price? Here's Another Hint At What It Could Cost
description: One of the biggest unknowns about Valve's Steam Machine is how much the cute little six-inch cube will cost. Plenty of people have offered their thoughts about where the price may land, and now Linus Sebastian of Linus Tech Tips has shared what he says Valve told him during a recent meeting. On the WAN Show, Linus said he has no idea what the Steam Machine price will be, but in speaking to Valve, he came away thinking the system won't be priced similarly to a new console. "When I said, 'I'm disappointed that it isn't going to follow a console pricing model where it's subsidized by the fact that the manufacturer is going to be taking 30% of every game sold on it over the lifespan of this thing, because I feel that would be a more meaningful product,' they kind of asked what I meant by, well, 'What do you mean by console price?' And I said, 'Well, $500,'" he said, as reported by IGN. Continue Reading at GameSpot
